content:
Morgan Housel
Morgan Housel Jimmy Carr:

In your 20s you worry about what everyone thinks of you. 

In your 30s you say “I don’t care what anyone thinks of me.”

In your 40s you realize they weren’t thinking about you the whole time.

Morgan Housel
Morgan Housel I wrote a new book: 

The Art of Spending Money 

Out October 7th.

If The Psychology of Money was about the mindset of growing wealth, this book focuses on how to use it. 

I don't lecture you how to spend, because everyone is different. This book is about: 

-Attention 
-Envy
-Social aspiration 
-Comfort 
-Happiness 
-Regret 
-Much more

Pre-order here: 

https://lnkd.in/gvV-N8nX

Morgan Housel
Morgan Housel Lacking real problems, a lot of people immediately stress out about fake or minor ones. It's like there's a minimum level of stress that they require.

Eric McArdle
Eric McArdle I'm late to this but I can't recommend "The Psychology of Money" by Morgan Housel enough. 

I'm a firm believer in "getting your ass kicked" to learn a lesson (at least that is what has stuck for me in the past), but this book does about as good of a job as possible in instilling many of those same hard-earned lessons from the comfort of your couch/dog walk/drive home. 

One advisor and friend goes as far as gifting this book to new clients. I would do the same!

https://lnkd.in/eK3cKHfN The Psychology of Money goodreads.com

Haris Bin Waris
Haris Bin Waris The best book i’ve read in the last 365 days! 

On my flight back home yesterday I read the new book of one of my favorite authors Morgan Housel 

Same as Ever.

This is more of a life guide about things you didn’t think you needed to know.

It’s a compilation of 23 little stories about things that never change. 

Here are 4 timeless lessons from the book.

Stress focus your attention in ways good times can’t which leads to disruptions and revolutionary innovations.

Everything worth pursuing comes with a little pain the trick is to not minding that it hurts.

Progress requires optimism and pessimism to coexist.

Best stories wins, stories are always more powerful than statistics, learning storytelling can help you succeed in every aspect of your life.
